full_summary:
===============

**Traffic Monitoring – Western Parks**

**Reference:** 5P420-23-0261/A  
**Publication date:** January 25, 2024  
**Tender closing date:** February 21, 2024, 4:00 PM local time  
**Period of Contract:** April 1, 2024 to March 31, 2029  
**Estimated value:** 

Parks Canada is soliciting bids for a network of Automated Traffic Recorders (ATRs) to be maintained on Parks Canada roads in Alberta and British Columbia within Jasper, Yoho, Kootenay, Waterton Lakes, Elk Island and Glacier National Parks. The selected contractor will be responsible for collecting traffic data, producing reports from the collected data and maintaining the equipment.

**Submission Guidelines:**

Parks Canada accepts submissions by email or fax only. Electronic submissions sent via SAP Ariba will not be accepted. Please ensure that submissions are sent to the specified email address: `soumissionsouest-bidswest@canada.ca`. Submissions must be in PDF format and can be up to 15 megabytes in size.

**Bid Documents:**

The bid documents can be downloaded from the Government Electronic Tendering Service at `http://canadabuys.canada.ca/en/tender-opportunities`. Addenda will also be available on this website.

**Evaluation Criteria:**

The evaluation will be based on the lowest price submitted under the terms and conditions specified in the bid solicitation documents.

**Communication:**

All inquiries of a technical and contractual nature must be submitted in writing to the Contracting Authority no later than seven calendar days prior to the bid closing date.

**Timeline:**

Parks Canada reserves the right to extend the contract period for up to four (4) additional one-year periods.

**Important Notes:**

*   Parks Canada will only accept bids submitted through the Government Electronic Tendering Service.
*   Late submissions will not be considered.
*   The Crown retains the right to negotiate with suppliers on any procurement.

**Trade Agreements:**

This procurement is subject to the Comprehensive and Progressive Agreement for Trans-Pacific Partnership (CPTPP), Canada-Peru Free Trade Agreement (CPFTA) and other international trade agreements.

**Federal Government Entity:** Canada.  
**Province:** Alberta (Alberta)...Colonne-Britannique (British Columbia).  
**Regions of delivery:** See details below.  
**Regions of opportunity:** World.  
**Tender Status:** Expired.Ignore None citations
